body: could you share your config file?

Sure thing !

```
project_name: myApp
builds:
  - env: [CGO_ENABLED=0]
    main: ./cmd/myApp/
    goos:
      - linux
      - darwin
    goarch:
      - amd64
      - arm64
    ldflags:
      - -X 'myApp/pkg/cloud.vaultRoleID={{.Env.VAULT_ROLEID}}'
      - -X 'myApp/pkg/cloud.vaultSecretID={{.Env.VAULT_SECRETID}}'
      - -X 'myApp/pkg/cloud.vaultCaCert={{.Env.VAULT_CACERT}}'
      - -X 'myApp/pkg/cmd.myAppVersion={{.Env.CI_COMMIT_TAG}}'

gitlab_urls:
  api: "{{.Env.CI_API_V4_URL}}"
  download: "{{.Env.CI_SERVER_URL}}"
  skip_tls_verify: false
  use_package_registry: true

announce:
  slack:
    enabled: true
    channel: '#some-channel'
```

we're probably setting it un-templated somewhere into the context: https://github.com/goreleaser/goreleaser/blob/main/internal/tmpl/tmpl.go#L100 

need to see where, and fix it there.

This likely affects more things...

Shouldn't it also process the username in a config like this one?
```yaml
artifactories:
  - name: production
    target: "{{ .Env.ARTIFACTORY_SERVER_ADDRESS }}/{{ .ProjectName }}/{{ .Version }}/" # rendered correctly
    mode: archive
    username: "{{ .USERNAME }}" # not rendered :( 
```
I can just set an env var with an user name :D that is pretty neat

> Shouldn't it also process the username in a config like this one?
> 
> ```yaml
> artifactories:
>   - name: production
>     target: "{{ .Env.ARTIFACTORY_SERVER_ADDRESS }}/{{ .ProjectName }}/{{ .Version }}/" # rendered correctly
>     mode: archive
>     username: "{{ .USERNAME }}" # not rendered :( 
> ```

please open another issue, a bug or a feature request, depending on what the docs say...

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.
